title: Systems of Equations - Matrix Operations - Part B

content.description: The function <math> <semantics> <mi>L</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGmbaaaa@39CD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a linear transformation of vectors defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="true">→</mo> </mover> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@423E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math> <semantics> <mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWG2bGbaSaaaaa@3A08@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a column vector and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>3</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>4</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40AD@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. It is known that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>L</mi><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>y</mi> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>7</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>19</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4625@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question:
Part B

Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>A</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaIXaaaaaaa@3B97@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Write, but do not evaluate, an expression that can be used to find the values of <math> <semantics> <mi>x</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHXgarmWu51MyVXgarqqtubsr4rNCHbcvPDwzYbGeaGqiFv0Je9sqqrpepiYdbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaaeaabaWaaaGcbaGaamiEaaaa@310B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mi>y</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHXgarmWu51MyVXgarqqtubsr4rNCHbcvPDwzYbGeaGqiFv0Je9sqqrpepiYdbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaaeaabaWaaaGcbaGaamiEaaaa@310B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The expression should be a product that involves one or more of the following: <math> <semantics> <mi>A</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHXgarmWu51MyVXgarqqtubsr4rNCHbcvPDwzYbGeaGqiFv0Je9sqqrpepiYdbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaaeaabaWaaaGcbaGaamiEaaaa@310B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>A</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaIXaaaaaaa@3B97@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>y</mi> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CF6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, or <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>7</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>19</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text:
Part B

Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>A</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaIXaaaaaaa@3B97@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Write, but do not evaluate, an expression that can be used to find the values of <math> <semantics> <mi>x</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHXgarmWu51MyVXgarqqtubsr4rNCHbcvPDwzYbGeaGqiFv0Je9sqqrpepiYdbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaaeaabaWaaaGcbaGaamiEaaaa@310B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mi>y</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHXgarmWu51MyVXgarqqtubsr4rNCHbcvPDwzYbGeaGqiFv0Je9sqqrpepiYdbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaaeaabaWaaaGcbaGaamiEaaaa@310B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The expression should be a product that involves one or more of the following: <math> <semantics> <mi>A</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHXgarmWu51MyVXgarqqtubsr4rNCHbcvPDwzYbGeaGqiFv0Je9sqqrpepiYdbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaaeaabaWaaaGcbaGaamiEaaaa@310B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>A</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaIXaaaaaaa@3B97@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>y</mi> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CF6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, or <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>7</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>19</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

topic.text: 4.11: The Inverse and Determinant of a Matrix

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
